1. Examine  the nature  of the  dataset  and its associated  meta-data  if available, e.g: data types, structure, size, and format.
3. Verify data understanding by explaining the meanings of their attributes and the scope of their values.
4. Investigate the quality of the data, e.g: missing values, outliers, and distribution.
5. Prospect the potential of the data based on the defined process objectives and using statistical measurements and other techniques discussed in chapter 4 (see section 4.6) and chapter 6 (see section 6.2.3).   
6. Gain insight into the data trends, distribution, and relationships between its features.
7. Confirm the relevance, sufficiency, and adequacy of data to fulfil the defined process objectives.
